content.description: Start as for Golfish Trombone, sitting at pockets at the back of the overhang. Bust a few hard moves up and right before breaking into the headwall. Steel fingers needed!
content.location: From the Central Happiness area, head up the canyon towards the Savannah boulder, then break right and head up towards the east rim. Look for a prominent prow; the Trombones are just behind it.

content.description:
A neat little problem to do in the area. Stand beneath the scoop feature to the right of

Swordfish Trombone

and jump up to a horizontal crack like feature. The holds you are jumping to are decent slopers. From here make a hard shouldery campus move out right to a decent edge and then with difficulty get you left foot on and move your hand up to a jug in the vertical crack above to slopers you jump to. Top out on good foot holds and good handholds.

There is also the "Trombone Traverse which is a good warm up. It start around the right side of the prow on jugs and traverses leftwards. You can mantel it pretty much anywhere or keep traversing into "Pupfish Souzaphone" at about a grade or so harder, due to the pump factor.
content.protection: A pad or two and possibly a spotter.
content.location:
Uphill from the

Savannah Boulder

. Once in the

Trombone Area

walk towards Goldfish Trombone, and you can't miss this bottomless scoop feature.

content.description: Start in the back of the overhang on thin pockets. Move up and left, under the prow and through a horrendous series of pockets, edges, and pinches. Finish by emerging on to the far side of the prow, making long & delicate reaches. Top it out, or walk off after the jug.
content.protection: Pad. There's a rock in the fall zone at the end of the problem.
content.location: From the Central Happiness area, head up the canyon towards the Savannah boulder. From there, cut right, towards the east lip of the canyon. Look for the prominent overhanging prow just below the lip of the canyon. Goldfish is just behind this prow.
